sponsor: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products R&D, Inc.
briefTitle: Study in Adult and Adolescent Subjects With PAR (Perennial Allergic Rhinitis)
officialTitle: Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Phase 3 Clinical Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol (320 Mcg, Once Daily) in the Treatment of Perennial Allergic Rhinitis (PAR) in Adult and Adolescent Subjects (12 Years of Age and Older)

interventions.name: Beclomethasone dipropionate hydrofluoroalkane HFA Nasal Aerosol

summary: The purpose of the study is to assess the efficacy and safety of an investigational nasal aerosol compared with placebo nasal aerosol in the treatment of perennial allergic rhinitis.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Average AM and PM Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS) Over the Six-week Treatment Period
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline (Days -3 to 0) and Days 1-43 (6-week Treatment Period)
